NineFingers_OM_Minsc_DuringCoup_COM.synopsis: Quick and short origin moment between Minsc and Nine-Fingers (Jaheira optional). The Zhent have just turned on the Guild, and Minsc and player must choose whether to help Nine-Fingers or not.
NineFingers_OM_Minsc_DuringCoup_COM.how_to_trigger: Free Minsc from the Absolute's thrall in the Abandoned Cistern, then go to the Guildhall. For this dialogue, the player will need to sneak in and speak to Nine-Fingers first somehow.

Ninefingers_OM_Minsc_OOM.synopsis: Minsc confronts Nine-Fingers after their temporary truce until the Zhent were defeated. He means to kill her, but she tries to convince him that the Guild is ultimately a force for good within the city.
Ninefingers_OM_Minsc_OOM.how_to_trigger: CTY_Main_AReCon: oe Guildhall_ZhentBetrayalTeleport to S_LOW_Guildhall_NineFingers_ef1b7a12-6439-470a-885c-fa47851728cd and save Nine fingers from the ZhentOOM: Talk to S_LOW_Guildhall_NineFingers_ef1b7a12-6439-470a-885c-fa47851728cd while controlling Minsc with no avatars nearby

BossFriol_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM.synopsis: Origin moment for Minsc + Jaheira with Boss Friol.After Minsc learns of the Zhentarim plans to overthrow Nine-Fingers, he returns to the Guildhall to confront their leader, Roah. She taunts him with his past evil deeds as the 'Stone Lord' - the player decideds whether to back Minsc and fight Roah, or let Roah's plan come to fruition for the 'greater good'.
BossFriol_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM.how_to_trigger: Go to Guildhall. (S_LOW_Guildhall_Entrance_a78a0b7b-489a-4743-9e6e-4c88f24cc2ca)Swap Roah with Friol by using ReCon: oe Guildhall_Swap_ZhentLeader Recruit Minsc + optionally jaheiraInitiate the Zhent takeover of the Guild by using ReCon: oe Guildhall_ZhentBetrayal

Roah_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM.synopsis: Origin moment for Minsc with Roah.After Minsc learns of the Zhentarim plans to overthrow Nine-Fingers, he returns to the Guildhall to confront their leader, Roah. She taunts him with his past evil deeds as the 'Stone Lord' - the player decideds whether to back Minsc and fight Roah, or let Roah's plan come to fruition for the 'greater good'.ATTN: This double origin moment was degraded to a single origin moment with only Minsc
Roah_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM.how_to_trigger: CTY_Main_ARecruit MinscDebug book (ctrl shift 9)- Set quest flags & options- Act 3 (LOW)- LOW - Guildhall- Guildhall State DuringCoup

NineFingers_OM_Minsc_DuringCoup_OOM.synopsis: Quick and short origin moment between Minsc and Nine-Fingers (Jaheira optional). The Zhent have just turned on the Guild, and Minsc and player must choose whether to help Nine-Fingers or not.
NineFingers_OM_Minsc_DuringCoup_OOM.how_to_trigger: Free Minsc from the Absolute's thrall in the Abandoned Cistern, then go to the Guildhall. For this dialogue, the player will need to sneak in and speak to Nine-Fingers first somehow.

Ninefingers_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM.synopsis: Note: OOM is moved to separate dialogMinsc confronts Nine-Fingers after their temporary truce until the Zhent were defeated. He means to kill her, but she tries to convince him that the Guild is ultimately a force for good within the city.
Ninefingers_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM.how_to_trigger: CTY_Main_AReCon: oe Guildhall_ZhentBetrayalTeleport to S_LOW_Guildhall_NineFingers_ef1b7a12-6439-470a-885c-fa47851728cd and save Nine fingers from the ZhentCOM: Talk to S_LOW_Guildhall_NineFingers_ef1b7a12-6439-470a-885c-fa47851728cd with Minsc present and in your party.

NineFingers_OM_Minsc_DuringCoup_COM_12.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
NineFingers_OM_Minsc_DuringCoup_COM_12.text: What has you sneaking aro - oh.

NineFingers_OM_Minsc_DuringCoup_COM_19.speaker: Minsc
NineFingers_OM_Minsc_DuringCoup_COM_19.text: Minsc does not sneak, queen cutpurse. He follows a direct line from boot to butt.

NineFingers_OM_Minsc_DuringCoup_COM_2.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
NineFingers_OM_Minsc_DuringCoup_COM_2.text: Turning the Zhentarim on me with my own coin. A dramatic entrance to land the killing blow yourself. I'll give you this, Stone Lord - you've got style.

NineFingers_OM_Minsc_DuringCoup_COM_4.speaker: Minsc
NineFingers_OM_Minsc_DuringCoup_COM_4.text: Minsc has no such style. We are here to cleanse the Zhentish taint, not to rub it all the deeper.

NineFingers_OM_Minsc_DuringCoup_COM_16.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
NineFingers_OM_Minsc_DuringCoup_COM_16.text: You expect me to believe that you're here to help me?

NineFingers_OM_Minsc_DuringCoup_COM_1.speaker: Player
NineFingers_OM_Minsc_DuringCoup_COM_1.text: Yes. Against the Zhent, at least.

NineFingers_OM_Minsc_DuringCoup_COM_10.speaker: Minsc
NineFingers_OM_Minsc_DuringCoup_COM_10.text: Helping first, and harming after! Justice dines to a set menu, Nine-Fingers - and Boo will be having seconds.

NineFingers_OM_Minsc_DuringCoup_COM_20.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
NineFingers_OM_Minsc_DuringCoup_COM_20.text: Don't let the hamster nibble on anything valuable, and we might just get along, Stone Lord.

NineFingers_OM_Minsc_DuringCoup_COM_5.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
NineFingers_OM_Minsc_DuringCoup_COM_5.text: Come then. There are visitors in my Guildhall. I'd be a poor host to keep them waiting!
NineFingers_OM_Minsc_DuringCoup_COM_5.context: NodeContext: Going into battle directly after

NineFingers_OM_Minsc_DuringCoup_COM_11.speaker: Player
NineFingers_OM_Minsc_DuringCoup_COM_11.text: Afraid not - I've decided the Guild needs a change in leadership.

NineFingers_OM_Minsc_DuringCoup_COM_13.speaker: Minsc
NineFingers_OM_Minsc_DuringCoup_COM_13.text: Hm. Boo intended to taste Zhentish flesh first, but... so be it. It would be greedy to seek out more skulls to crack when we have not finished the one in front of us.

NineFingers_OM_Minsc_DuringCoup_COM_3.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
NineFingers_OM_Minsc_DuringCoup_COM_3.text: Oh, I'm likely to give you indigestion. But you and your Zhentish friends are free to try!

NineFingers_OM_Minsc_DuringCoup_COM_17.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
NineFingers_OM_Minsc_DuringCoup_COM_17.text: My hero. So you're here to help?

Ninefingers_OM_Minsc_OOM_19.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
Ninefingers_OM_Minsc_OOM_19.text: Kind of you to take the Zhentarim down first, but that doesn't make us friends.

Ninefingers_OM_Minsc_OOM_20.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
Ninefingers_OM_Minsc_OOM_20.text: Come on then, Stone Lord - if you mean to take my chair, you'll get no better chance than this.
Ninefingers_OM_Minsc_OOM_20.context: NodeContext: Just after one battle but her blood is up now and she's ready for us to attack - urging us to do it

Ninefingers_OM_Minsc_OOM_23.speaker: Minsc
Ninefingers_OM_Minsc_OOM_23.text: Minsc has no interest in your furniture, Nine-Fingers - only in the wicked rump that fills it!
Ninefingers_OM_Minsc_OOM_23.context: NodeContext: Stressing that he's Minsc and not the Stone Lord

Ninefingers_OM_Minsc_OOM_9.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
Ninefingers_OM_Minsc_OOM_9.context: NodeContext: Bemusement cutting through her bloodlust for a moment

Ninefingers_OM_Minsc_OOM_17.speaker: Minsc
Ninefingers_OM_Minsc_OOM_17.text: You have been a stone in this city's boot for too long. And it will be no Stone Lord who reaches 'twixt Balduran's sticky toes to dislodge you - it will be Minsc!
Ninefingers_OM_Minsc_OOM_17.context: NodeContext: Powering through, oblivious of Nine-Fingers' confusion

Ninefingers_OM_Minsc_OOM_3.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
Ninefingers_OM_Minsc_OOM_3.text: Good. I'd rather you die as Minsc the mad Rashemaar. It's silly, but - d'you know you were something of a hero of mine, when I was young?
Ninefingers_OM_Minsc_OOM_3.context: NodeContext: To Minsc. Not sentimental, just stating a curious fact before we get to the killing. Amusement at herself on the second line.

Ninefingers_OM_Minsc_OOM_11.speaker: Minsc
Ninefingers_OM_Minsc_OOM_11.text: Even now, your tongue twists the truth. When you were young and ten-fingered still, Minsc and Boo were stone - enstatuated on a city square!
Ninefingers_OM_Minsc_OOM_11.context: NodeContext: Scornful, thinking Nine-Fingers is just trying to lie to him in order to be spared

Ninefingers_OM_Minsc_OOM_1.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
Ninefingers_OM_Minsc_OOM_1.text: Aye, I remember the spot - by a garden on the Wide. A soft thicket near the market, with ample pockets to pick. Celestia itself, to a street rat looking for shelter.
Ninefingers_OM_Minsc_OOM_1.context: NodeContext: Wry and rueful, remembering it with fond amusement - Nine-Fingers was abducted as a child and, even after being ransomed, left her family to fend for herself. She doesn't speak of her traumatic past with any great pathos - she's seen worse in the city.

Ninefingers_OM_Minsc_OOM_16.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
Ninefingers_OM_Minsc_OOM_16.text: You might not have been wrestling monsters, but... you kept the wind and the rain off. Heroic enough for me.
Ninefingers_OM_Minsc_OOM_16.context: NodeContext: Shrug - again denying any sentimentality, just stating facts.

Ninefingers_OM_Minsc_OOM_6.speaker: Minsc
Ninefingers_OM_Minsc_OOM_6.text: ...bah! You try to dampen Boo's eyes. Do not think you will be spared his teeth! Evil is evil, even if it once was... innocent.
Ninefingers_OM_Minsc_OOM_6.context: NodeContext: Emotional at the story and pouring it all into his denial instead. His loudness is proportional to his depth of feeling.

Ninefingers_OM_Minsc_OOM_13.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
Ninefingers_OM_Minsc_OOM_13.text: Oh, I'm no innocent. But evil? You tell me. With the Fist, the watch,  and the Council itself all licking the Absolute's boots, who's the only one left standing to protect Baldur's Gate?
Ninefingers_OM_Minsc_OOM_13.context: NodeContext: Shrugging, not buying Minsc's black and white. She's fervent proud about the Guild's place as the city's true defender, and won't be told otherwise

Ninefingers_OM_Minsc_OOM_8.speaker: Jaheira
Ninefingers_OM_Minsc_OOM_8.text: She's right, Minsc. She's been an ally down through the years. A friend, even.

Ninefingers_OM_Minsc_OOM_21.speaker: Minsc
Ninefingers_OM_Minsc_OOM_21.text: A friend? Jaheira, Boo cannot believe his ears! Has the city fallen so far in our absence? Are there no heroes left?

Ninefingers_OM_Minsc_OOM_22.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
Ninefingers_OM_Minsc_OOM_22.text: Heroes come and go, but the Guild has always been here, protecting the city. Until the Stone Lord came to break us.
Ninefingers_OM_Minsc_OOM_22.context: NodeContext: Still ready to fight and kill Minsc - not letting him off the hook for what he's done

Ninefingers_OM_Minsc_OOM_12.speaker: Minsc
Ninefingers_OM_Minsc_OOM_12.text: No. Minsc has not always done what is right - but evil is evil. It is a choice - and Nine-Fingers made hers a long time ago.

Ninefingers_OM_Minsc_OOM_14.speaker: Minsc
Ninefingers_OM_Minsc_OOM_14.text: That story you told... if it be true, then... I am sorry I could not save you then.

Ninefingers_OM_Minsc_OOM_24.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
Ninefingers_OM_Minsc_OOM_24.text: Oh, you fool. I didn't need saving - from you, or anyone else. But - I suppose I'm sorry, too.

Ninefingers_OM_Minsc_OOM_10.speaker: Jaheira
Ninefingers_OM_Minsc_OOM_10.context: NodeContext: At a loss - wanting to keep the peace between them but knowing it's going to come to blows.

Ninefingers_OM_Minsc_OOM_4.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
Ninefingers_OM_Minsc_OOM_4.text: You tried, Harper. Don't worry - I never expected you'd let your friend die without a fight. That's one of the reasons I liked you.
Ninefingers_OM_Minsc_OOM_4.context: NodeContext: Shrugging, pragmatic - she genuinely likes and respects Jaheira, but knows that if Minsc dies, so must she. Won't hold it against Jaheira for trying to kill her in return, it's inevitable.

BossFriol_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_23.speaker: Boss Friol
BossFriol_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_23.text: So it's that simple! Drop your weapons, bring out Nine-Fingers, and this can all end peacefully! For you, at least.
BossFriol_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_23.context: CinematicNodeContext: Party enters the Guildhall to find Friol standing at the railing, addressing the crwod. Her Zhentarim stand arrayed for battle, with the Guild standing defensively against them. She finishes her line, and turns to greet us.

BossFriol_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_33.speaker: Boss Friol
BossFriol_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_33.text: What's this, Stone Lord? Bit late to change the terms of our deal - we've already begun.

BossFriol_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_51.speaker: Minsc
BossFriol_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_51.text: The Stone Lord is no more. Boo and Jaheira and my friend would not let me stay cursed.

BossFriol_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_50.speaker: Minsc
BossFriol_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_50.text: And the only terms we offer are between my boot and your treacherous buttocks.

BossFriol_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_56.speaker: Boss Friol
BossFriol_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_56.text: Unfortunate. But if you'll only listen a moment, you'll see we want the same thing.

BossFriol_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_57.speaker: Minsc
BossFriol_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_57.text: Oh? Minsc is wanting to close your mouth with a kick. And you?

BossFriol_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_8.speaker: Boss Friol
BossFriol_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_8.text: Justice. Nine-Fingers, punished for what she did to you. And the Zhentarim, rewarded for their stead-fastedness.

BossFriol_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_43.speaker: Boss Friol
BossFriol_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_43.text: The Zhentarim have been trying to crack Baldur's Gate for years. No better time than now, with Nine-Fingers on the back foot.

BossFriol_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_29.speaker: Boss Friol
BossFriol_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_29.text: A Guild under our control can do what Nine-Fingers failed to - drive the Absolute out of the city, once and for all.

BossFriol_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_54.speaker: Boss Friol
BossFriol_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_54.text: And then reap the spoils. Stay on in the city, as its true protectors. For a reasonable fee, of course.

BossFriol_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_53.speaker: Minsc
BossFriol_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_53.text: My hamster can smell your lies, villain. Foul not his little nose.
BossFriol_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_53.context: NodeContext: Not believing her bullshit, growled threat

BossFriol_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_37.speaker: Boss Friol
BossFriol_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_37.text: Let's have the truth, then. Do your friends know how many you killed in the Absolute's name, Stone Lord? Do you?

BossFriol_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_31.speaker: Minsc
BossFriol_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_31.text: I... do not call me that. Minsc is Minsc!
BossFriol_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_31.context: NodeContext: Thrown, but insistent - he does not want to remember the things he did.

BossFriol_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_45.speaker: Boss Friol
BossFriol_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_45.text: Funny that. The Minsc of the old days would've been no friend to Nine-Fingers - a known thief, a murderer. That Minsc served the side of good.

BossFriol_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_4.speaker: Minsc
BossFriol_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_4.context: CinematicNodeContext: Bowing his head, dejectedNodeContext: For once, has no response

BossFriol_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_64.speaker: Boss Friol
BossFriol_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_64.text: No judgement. It's hard to know the right thing. Better to let others do the thinking, eh?

BossFriol_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_58.speaker: Minsc
BossFriol_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_58.context: NodeContext: Raising his head, no longer despondent.

BossFriol_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_11.speaker: Minsc
BossFriol_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_11.text: Your leader is not wrong. The Guild is a band of treacherous scoundrels, and Nine-Fingers the worst among them!
BossFriol_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_11.context: CinematicNodeContext: Minsc looking up, dejection to hope. He nods and steps forward to stand beside Roah, facing the gathered Zhentarim below.

BossFriol_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_16.speaker: Minsc
BossFriol_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_16.text: But the Stone Lord... Minsc... was many times worse. I have no right to judge.

BossFriol_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_38.speaker: Minsc
BossFriol_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_38.text: So it will not be Minsc who does the judging.
BossFriol_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_38.context: CinematicNodeContext: Standard animation as he reaches into inventory out of frame - and comes back with Boo in his hand, held over the crowd.NodeContext: Include gesture of getting Boo from magic pocket and holding in front of him, Boo sat in Minsc's Palm.

BossFriol_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_26.speaker: Minsc
BossFriol_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_26.text: MY HAMSTER WILL COUNT TO THREE! LAY DOWN YOUR ARMS, ZHENTARIM, AND BOO WILL SPARE YOUR LIVES!

BossFriol_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_52.speaker: Boss Friol
BossFriol_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_52.text: Think about this. It defies all logic, I -

BossFriol_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_63.speaker: Boss Friol
BossFriol_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_63.text: So it's that simple! Drop your weapons, bring out Nine-Fingers, and this can all end peacefully! For you, at least.
BossFriol_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_63.context: CinematicNodeContext: Party enters the Guildhall to find Friol standing at the railing, addressing the crwod. Her Zhentarim stand arrayed for battle, with the Guild standing defensively against them. She finishes her line, and turns to greet us.

BossFriol_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_62.speaker: Boss Friol
BossFriol_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_62.text: What's this, Stone Lord? Bit late to change the terms of our deal - we've already begun.

BossFriol_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_12.speaker: Minsc
BossFriol_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_12.text: The Stone Lord is no more. Boo and Jaheira and my friend would not let me stay cursed.

BossFriol_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_55.speaker: Minsc
BossFriol_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_55.text: And the only terms we offer are between my boot and your treacherous buttocks.

BossFriol_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_28.speaker: Boss Friol
BossFriol_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_28.text: A pity, that. And he speaks for you, too?

BossFriol_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_6.speaker: Boss Friol
BossFriol_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_6.text: I may have lied to that lot about this ending peacefully. But you can still pick the right side.

BossFriol_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_61.speaker: Player
BossFriol_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_61.text: What are you doing? Why turn on the Guild?

BossFriol_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_36.speaker: Boss Friol
BossFriol_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_36.text: We're turning on Nine-Fingers. She's been running this place into the ground for some time.

BossFriol_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_2.speaker: Boss Friol
BossFriol_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_2.text: The Zhentarim have been trying to crack Baldur's Gate for years. No better time than now, with Nine-Fingers on the back foot.

BossFriol_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_24.speaker: Boss Friol
BossFriol_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_24.text: Her Guild is a shambles. The cult broke them in a matter of days - but not the Zhentarim.

BossFriol_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_20.speaker: Boss Friol
BossFriol_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_20.text: A Guild under our control can do what Nine-Fingers failed to - drive the Absolute out of the city, once and for all.

BossFriol_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_17.speaker: Boss Friol
BossFriol_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_17.text: And then reap the spoils. Stay on in the city, as its true protectors. For a reasonable fee, of course.

BossFriol_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_1.speaker: Minsc
BossFriol_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_1.text: My hamster can smell your lies, villain. Foul not his little nose.
BossFriol_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_1.context: NodeContext: Not believing her bullshit, growled threat

BossFriol_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_14.speaker: Boss Friol
BossFriol_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_14.text: Let's have the truth, then. Do your friends know how many you killed in the Absolute's name, Stone Lord? Do you?

BossFriol_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_22.speaker: Minsc
BossFriol_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_22.text: I... do not call me that. Minsc is Minsc!
BossFriol_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_22.context: NodeContext: Thrown, but insistent - he does not want to remember the things he did.

BossFriol_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_60.speaker: Boss Friol
BossFriol_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_60.text: Funny that. The Minsc of the old days would've been no friend to Nine-Fingers - a known thief, a murderer. That Minsc served the side of good.

BossFriol_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_47.speaker: Minsc
BossFriol_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_47.context: CinematicNodeContext: Bowing his head, dejectedNodeContext: For once, has no response

BossFriol_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_35.speaker: Boss Friol
BossFriol_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_35.text: No judgement, big lad. Some people give orders. Some people follow 'em. You know which you are, now.

BossFriol_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_44.speaker: Boss Friol
BossFriol_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_44.text: Just leave it to us grown-ups. Because I know your friend will make the smart choice.

BossFriol_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_5.speaker: Player
BossFriol_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_5.text: You're mistaken. Minsc of Rashemen always knows the right thing to do.

BossFriol_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_3.speaker: Minsc
BossFriol_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_3.text: Your leader is not wrong. The Guild is a band of treacherous scoundrels, and Nine-Fingers the worst among them!
BossFriol_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_3.context: CinematicNodeContext: Minsc looking up, dejection to hope. He nods and steps forward to stand beside Roah, facing the gathered Zhentarim below.

BossFriol_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_7.speaker: Minsc
BossFriol_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_7.text: But the Stone Lord... Minsc... was many times worse. I have no right to judge.

BossFriol_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_34.speaker: Minsc
BossFriol_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_34.text: So it will not be Minsc who does the judging.
BossFriol_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_34.context: CinematicNodeContext: Standard animation as he reaches into inventory out of frame - and comes back with Boo in his hand, held over the crowd.NodeContext: Include gesture of getting Boo from magic pocket and holding in front of him, Boo sat in Minsc's Palm.

BossFriol_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_27.speaker: Minsc
BossFriol_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_27.text: MY HAMSTER WILL COUNT TO THREE! LAY DOWN YOUR ARMS, ZHENTARIM, AND BOO WILL SPARE YOUR LIVES!

BossFriol_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_30.speaker: Boss Friol
BossFriol_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_30.text: Truly? I am handing you the Guild, and you'd throw it all away on the word of a madman?

BossFriol_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_13.speaker: Boss Friol
BossFriol_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_13.text: Think about this. It defies all logic, I -

BossFriol_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_15.speaker: Player
BossFriol_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_15.text: We stand with the Guild. So get out of the way.

BossFriol_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_21.speaker: Boss Friol
BossFriol_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_21.text: You're making a big mistake. And for what? There's no sense in this - no profit. Nobody goes against the Zhent and lives.

BossFriol_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_39.speaker: Minsc
BossFriol_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_39.text: Enough of your filth. Cover your ears Boo. The cracking of the necks of evil will be louder than the mating cries of a snow tiger.

BossFriol_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_0.speaker: Player
BossFriol_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_0.text: Fine. Give your Zhentarim the order - we take this place, and split the spoils.

BossFriol_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_25.speaker: Minsc
BossFriol_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_25.text: Why would you side with this villain? Boo does not... I do not understand.

BossFriol_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_48.speaker: Boss Friol
BossFriol_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_48.text: Cheer up, Minsc - this is about the greater good. Maybe your hamster will explain it to you one day.
BossFriol_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_48.context: CinematicNodeContext: She cups a hand beside her ear in the direction of Nine-Fingers' office.

BossFriol_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_49.speaker: Boss Friol
BossFriol_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_49.text: Enough negotiations, Zhentarim! It's time to take our due!
BossFriol_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_49.context: NodeContext: Turning to shout at her people gathered below.

BossFriol_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_40.speaker: Player
BossFriol_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_40.text: I will. But I don't think you'll like my choice.

BossFriol_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_10.speaker: Boss Friol
BossFriol_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_10.text: You're smarter than this. You know which way the wind's blowing.

Roah_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_10.speaker: Roah Moonglow
Roah_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_10.text: So it's that simple! Drop your weapons, bring out Nine-Fingers, and this can all end peacefully! For you, at least.
Roah_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_10.context: CinematicNodeContext: Party enters the Guildhall to find Roah standing at the railing, addressing the crwod. Her Zhentarim stand arrayed for battle, with the Guild standing defensively against them. She finishes her line, and turns to greet us.

Roah_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_51.speaker: Roah Moonglow
Roah_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_51.text: What's this, Stone Lord? It's a little late to change the terms of our deal - the pieces are already in place.

Roah_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_64.speaker: Minsc
Roah_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_64.text: The Stone Lord is no more. Boo and Jaheira and my friend would not let me stay cursed.

Roah_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_17.speaker: Minsc
Roah_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_17.text: And the only terms we offer are between my boot and your treacherous buttocks.

Roah_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_42.speaker: Roah Moonglow
Roah_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_42.text: I see. That's unfortunate. And what about the adult in the room?

Roah_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_60.speaker: Roah Moonglow
Roah_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_60.text: Whatever I told that lot below, this will end in bloodshed. All you have to do is pick the right side.

Roah_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_37.speaker: Player
Roah_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_37.text: What are you doing? Why turn on the Guild?

Roah_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_57.speaker: Roah Moonglow
Roah_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_57.text: I'm not. I'm turning on Nine-Fingers - this place has been due a change in management for some time.

Roah_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_19.speaker: Roah Moonglow
Roah_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_19.text: The Zhentarim have been trying to crack Baldur's Gate for years, but Nine-Fingers' grip has been too strong. And look what it's come to.

Roah_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_20.speaker: Roah Moonglow
Roah_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_20.text: Her Guild is disorganised. Undisciplined. The cult broke them in a matter of days, while my Zhentarim still stand strong.

Roah_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_62.speaker: Roah Moonglow
Roah_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_62.text: A Guild under our control can do what Nine-Fingers failed to - drive the Absolute out of the city, once and for all.

Roah_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_36.speaker: Roah Moonglow
Roah_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_36.text: And then remain on in the city, to protect its good citizens from any future threats. For a reasonable fee, of course.

Roah_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_63.speaker: Minsc
Roah_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_63.text: My hamster can smell your lies, villain. Foul not his little nose.
Roah_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_63.context: NodeContext: Not believing her bullshit, growled threat

Roah_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_26.speaker: Roah Moonglow
Roah_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_26.text: Fine. Let us talk of truth, then. Do your friends know how many you killed in the Absolute's name, Stone Lord? Do you?

Roah_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_50.speaker: Minsc
Roah_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_50.text: I... do not call me that. Minsc is Minsc!
Roah_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_50.context: NodeContext: Thrown, but insistent - he does not want to remember the things he did.

Roah_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_14.speaker: Roah Moonglow
Roah_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_14.text: Oh? I don't recall any tales of Minsc helping the likes of Nine-Fingers - a known thief, a murderer. I thought Minsc of Rashemen served the side of good?

Roah_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_47.speaker: Minsc
Roah_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_47.context: CinematicNodeContext: Bowing his head, dejectedNodeContext: For once, has no response

Roah_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_5.speaker: Roah Moonglow
Roah_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_5.text: I'm the last to judge, big man. You were just following orders. And hey - that's all you have to do now.

Roah_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_22.speaker: Roah Moonglow
Roah_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_22.text: If you don't know what's right, just let the grown-ups talk. Because I know your friend will make the smart choice.

Roah_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_11.speaker: Player
Roah_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_11.text: You're mistaken. Minsc of Rashemen always knows the right thing to do.

Roah_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_40.speaker: Minsc
Roah_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_40.text: Your leader is not wrong. The Guild is a band of treacherous scoundrels, and Nine-Fingers the worst among them!
Roah_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_40.context: CinematicNodeContext: Minsc looking up, dejection to hope. He nods and steps forward to stand beside Roah, facing the gathered Zhentarim below.

Roah_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_58.speaker: Minsc
Roah_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_58.text: But the Stone Lord... Minsc... was many times worse. I have no right to judge.

Roah_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_3.speaker: Minsc
Roah_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_3.text: So it will not be Minsc who does the judging.
Roah_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_3.context: CinematicNodeContext: Standard animation as he reaches into inventory out of frame - and comes back with Boo in his hand, held over the crowd.NodeContext: Include gesture of getting Boo from magic pocket and holding in front of him, Boo sat in Minsc's Palm.

Roah_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_45.speaker: Minsc
Roah_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_45.text: MY HAMSTER WILL COUNT TO THREE! LAY DOWN YOUR ARMS, ZHENTARIM, AND BOO WILL SPARE YOUR LIVES!

Roah_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_43.speaker: Roah Moonglow
Roah_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_43.text: Truly? I am handing you the Guild, and you'd throw it all away on the word of a madman?

Roah_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_21.speaker: Roah Moonglow
Roah_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_21.text: Think about this. It defies all logic, I -

Roah_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_30.speaker: Player
Roah_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_30.text: We stand with the Guild. So get out of the way.

Roah_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_53.speaker: Roah Moonglow
Roah_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_53.text: You're making a big mistake. And for what? There's no sense in this - no profit. Nobody goes against the Zhent and lives.

Roah_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_35.speaker: Minsc
Roah_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_35.text: Enough of your filth. Cover your ears Boo. The cracking of the necks of evil will be louder than the mating cries of a snow tiger.

Roah_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_25.speaker: Player
Roah_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_25.text: Fine. Give your Zhentarim the order - we take this place, and split the spoils.

Roah_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_16.speaker: Minsc
Roah_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_16.text: Why would you side with this villain? Boo does not... I do not understand.

Roah_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_18.speaker: Roah Moonglow
Roah_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_18.text: Cheer up, Minsc - this is about the greater good. Maybe your hamster will explain it to you one day.
Roah_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_18.context: CinematicNodeContext: She cups a hand beside her ear in the direction of Nine-Fingers' office.

Roah_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_59.speaker: Roah Moonglow
Roah_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_59.text: Enough negotiations, Zhentarim! It's time to take our due!
Roah_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_59.context: NodeContext: Turning to shout at her people gathered below.

Roah_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_13.speaker: Player
Roah_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_13.text: I will. But I don't think you'll like my choice.

Roah_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_56.speaker: Roah Moonglow
Roah_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_56.text: Hah, a hero. There's a time for heroics, my friend, and a time for common sense. This is the latter.

Roah_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_23.speaker: Roah Moonglow
Roah_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_23.text: So it's that simple! Drop your weapons, bring out Nine-Fingers, and this can all end peacefully! For you, at least.
Roah_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_23.context: CinematicNodeContext: Party enters the Guildhall to find Roah standing at the railing, addressing the crwod. Her Zhentarim stand arrayed for battle, with the Guild standing defensively against them. She finishes her line, and turns to greet us.

Roah_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_48.speaker: Roah Moonglow
Roah_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_48.text: What's this, Stone Lord? It's a little late to change the terms of our deal - the pieces are already in place.

Roah_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_28.speaker: Minsc
Roah_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_28.text: The Stone Lord is no more. Boo and Jaheira and my friend would not let me stay cursed.

Roah_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_1.speaker: Minsc
Roah_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_1.text: And the only terms we offer are between my boot and your treacherous buttocks.

Roah_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_38.speaker: Roah Moonglow
Roah_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_38.text: Unfortunate. But if you'll only listen a moment, you'll see we want the same thing.

Roah_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_7.speaker: Minsc
Roah_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_7.text: Oh? Minsc is wanting is to close your mouth with a kick. And you?

Roah_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_29.speaker: Roah Moonglow
Roah_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_29.text: Justice. Nine-Fingers, punished for what she did to you. And the Zhentarim, rewarded for their stead-fastedness.

Roah_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_41.speaker: Roah Moonglow
Roah_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_41.text: The Zhentarim have been trying to crack Baldur's Gate for years, but Nine-Fingers' grip has been too strong. And look what it's come to.

Roah_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_33.speaker: Roah Moonglow
Roah_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_33.text: A Guild under our control can do what Nine-Fingers failed to - drive the Absolute out of the city, once and for all.

Roah_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_27.speaker: Roah Moonglow
Roah_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_27.text: And then remain on in the city, to protect its good citizens from any future threats. For a reasonable fee, of course.

Roah_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_32.speaker: Minsc
Roah_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_32.text: My hamster can smell your lies, villain. Foul not his little nose.
Roah_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_32.context: NodeContext: Not believing her bullshit, growled threat

Roah_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_46.speaker: Roah Moonglow
Roah_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_46.text: Fine. Let us talk of truth, then. Do your friends know how many you killed in the Absolute's name, Stone Lord? Do you?

Roah_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_54.speaker: Minsc
Roah_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_54.text: I... do not call me that. Minsc is Minsc!
Roah_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_54.context: NodeContext: Thrown, but insistent - he does not want to remember the things he did.

Roah_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_6.speaker: Roah Moonglow
Roah_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_6.text: Oh? I don't recall any tales of Minsc helping the likes of Nine-Fingers - a known thief, a murderer. I thought Minsc of Rashemen served the side of good?

Roah_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_61.speaker: Minsc
Roah_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_61.context: CinematicNodeContext: Bowing his head, dejectedNodeContext: For once, has no response

Roah_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_55.speaker: Roah Moonglow
Roah_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_55.text: No judgement. It's hard to know the right thing. Better to let others do the thinking, eh?

Roah_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_2.speaker: Minsc
Roah_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_2.context: NodeContext: Raising his head, no longer despondent.

Roah_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_49.speaker: Minsc
Roah_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_49.text: Your leader is not wrong. The Guild is a band of treacherous scoundrels, and Nine-Fingers the worst among them!
Roah_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_49.context: CinematicNodeContext: Minsc looking up, dejection to hope. He nods and steps forward to stand beside Roah, facing the gathered Zhentarim below.

Roah_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_9.speaker: Minsc
Roah_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_9.text: But the Stone Lord... Minsc... was many times worse. I have no right to judge.

Roah_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_39.speaker: Minsc
Roah_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_39.text: So it will not be Minsc who does the judging.
Roah_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_39.context: CinematicNodeContext: Standard animation as he reaches into inventory out of frame - and comes back with Boo in his hand, held over the crowd.NodeContext: Include gesture of getting Boo from magic pocket and holding in front of him, Boo sat in Minsc's Palm.

Roah_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_24.speaker: Minsc
Roah_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_24.text: MY HAMSTER WILL COUNT TO THREE! LAY DOWN YOUR ARMS, ZHENTARIM, AND BOO WILL SPARE YOUR LIVES!

Roah_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_12.speaker: Roah Moonglow
Roah_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_12.text: Think about this. It defies all logic, I -

NineFingers_OM_Minsc_DuringCoup_OOM_4.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
NineFingers_OM_Minsc_DuringCoup_OOM_4.text: What has you sneaking aro - oh.

NineFingers_OM_Minsc_DuringCoup_OOM_6.speaker: Minsc
NineFingers_OM_Minsc_DuringCoup_OOM_6.text: Minsc does not sneak, queen cutpurse. He follows a direct line from boot to butt.

NineFingers_OM_Minsc_DuringCoup_OOM_0.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
NineFingers_OM_Minsc_DuringCoup_OOM_0.text: Turning the Zhentarim on me with my own coin. A dramatic entrance to land the killing blow yourself. I'll give you this, Stone Lord - you've got style.

NineFingers_OM_Minsc_DuringCoup_OOM_1.speaker: Minsc
NineFingers_OM_Minsc_DuringCoup_OOM_1.text: Minsc has no such style. We are here to cleanse the Zhentish taint, not to rub it all the deeper.

NineFingers_OM_Minsc_DuringCoup_OOM_5.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
NineFingers_OM_Minsc_DuringCoup_OOM_5.text: My hero. So you're here to help?

NineFingers_OM_Minsc_DuringCoup_OOM_3.speaker: Minsc
NineFingers_OM_Minsc_DuringCoup_OOM_3.text: Helping first, and harming after! Justice dines to a set menu, Nine-Fingers - and Boo will be having seconds.

NineFingers_OM_Minsc_DuringCoup_OOM_7.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
NineFingers_OM_Minsc_DuringCoup_OOM_7.text: Don't let the hamster nibble on anything valuable, and we might just get along, Stone Lord.

NineFingers_OM_Minsc_DuringCoup_OOM_2.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
NineFingers_OM_Minsc_DuringCoup_OOM_2.text: Come then. There are visitors in my Guildhall. I'd be a poor host to keep them waiting!
NineFingers_OM_Minsc_DuringCoup_OOM_2.context: NodeContext: Going into battle directly after

Ninefingers_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_50.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
Ninefingers_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_50.text: Kind of you to take the Zhentarim down first, but that doesn't make us friends.

Ninefingers_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_60.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
Ninefingers_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_60.text: Come on then, Stone Lord - if you mean to take my chair, you'll get no better chance than this.
Ninefingers_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_60.context: NodeContext: Just after one battle but her blood is up now and she's ready for us to attack - urging us to do it

Ninefingers_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_68.speaker: Minsc
Ninefingers_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_68.text: Minsc has no interest in your furniture, Nine-Fingers - only in the wicked rump that fills it!
Ninefingers_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_68.context: NodeContext: Stressing that he's Minsc and not the Stone Lord

Ninefingers_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_22.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
Ninefingers_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_22.context: NodeContext: Bemusement cutting through her bloodlust for a moment

Ninefingers_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_46.speaker: Minsc
Ninefingers_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_46.text: You have been a stone in this city's boot for too long. And it will be no Stone Lord who reaches 'twixt Balduran's sticky toes to dislodge you - it will be Minsc!
Ninefingers_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_46.context: NodeContext: Powering through, oblivious of Nine-Fingers' confusion

Ninefingers_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_86.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
Ninefingers_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_86.text: I haven't got the slightest idea what he's trying to say.
Ninefingers_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_86.context: NodeContext: shrugging at the player, start contrast to Minsc' grand pronouncements

Ninefingers_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_65.speaker: Jaheira
Ninefingers_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_65.text: Proof that he is back to normal, no?

Ninefingers_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_18.speaker: Player
Ninefingers_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_18.text: Minsc, calm down. The battle is over.

Ninefingers_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_41.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
Ninefingers_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_41.text: So the hound answers to his name again, does he? And you didn't have to put him down.
Ninefingers_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_41.context: NodeContext: to player, finally clicking that Minsc is back to himself

Ninefingers_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_51.speaker: Player
Ninefingers_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_51.text: He's been like this ever since I knocked some sense back into him.

Ninefingers_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_16.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
Ninefingers_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_16.text: You might have knocked it out. But a good thing you did - he's more like his old self again.
Ninefingers_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_16.context: NodeContext: In response to player saying they knocked sense into Minsc - but satisfied

Ninefingers_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_9.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
Ninefingers_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_9.text: Good. I'd rather you die as Minsc the mad Rashemaar. It's silly, but - d'you know you were something of a hero of mine, when I was young?
Ninefingers_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_9.context: NodeContext: To Minsc. Not sentimental, just stating a curious fact before we get to the killing. Amusement at herself on the second line.

Ninefingers_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_29.speaker: Minsc
Ninefingers_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_29.text: Even now, your tongue twists the truth. When you were young and ten-fingered still, Minsc and Boo were stone - enstatuated on a city square!
Ninefingers_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_29.context: NodeContext: Scornful, thinking Nine-Fingers is just trying to lie to him in order to be spared

Ninefingers_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_5.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
Ninefingers_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_5.text: Aye, I remember the spot - by a garden on the Wide. A soft thicket near the market, with ample pockets to pick. Celestia itself, to a street rat looking for shelter.
Ninefingers_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_5.context: NodeContext: Wry and rueful, remembering it with fond amusement - Nine-Fingers was abducted as a child and, even after being ransomed, left her family to fend for herself. She doesn't speak of her traumatic past with any great pathos - she's seen worse in the city.

Ninefingers_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_40.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
Ninefingers_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_40.text: You might not have been wrestling monsters, but... you kept the wind and the rain off. Heroic enough for me.
Ninefingers_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_40.context: NodeContext: Shrug - again denying any sentimentality, just stating facts.

Ninefingers_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_14.speaker: Minsc
Ninefingers_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_14.text: ...bah! You try to dampen Boo's eyes. Do not think you will be spared his teeth! Evil is evil, even if it once was... innocent.
Ninefingers_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_14.context: NodeContext: Emotional at the story and pouring it all into his denial instead. His loudness is proportional to his depth of feeling.

Ninefingers_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_35.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
Ninefingers_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_35.text: Oh, I'm no innocent. But evil? You tell me. With the Fist, the watch,  and the Council itself all licking the Absolute's boots, who's the only one left standing to protect Baldur's Gate?
Ninefingers_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_35.context: NodeContext: Shrugging, not buying Minsc's black and white. She's fervent proud about the Guild's place as the city's true defender, and won't be told otherwise

Ninefingers_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_19.speaker: Jaheira
Ninefingers_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_19.text: She's right, Minsc. She's been an ally down through the years. A friend, even.

Ninefingers_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_62.speaker: Minsc
Ninefingers_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_62.text: A friend? Jaheira, Boo cannot believe his ears! Has the city fallen so far in our absence? Are there no heroes left?

Ninefingers_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_67.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
Ninefingers_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_67.text: Heroes come and go, but the Guild has always been here, protecting the city. Until the Stone Lord came to break us.
Ninefingers_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_67.context: NodeContext: Still ready to fight and kill Minsc - not letting him off the hook for what he's done

Ninefingers_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_96.speaker: Player
Ninefingers_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_96.text: Well, ranger? You cannot always leave it up to your wychlaran. Make a choice.

Ninefingers_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_44.speaker: Minsc
Ninefingers_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_44.text: Heh. Jaheira says she is no wychlaran. Perhaps not. But if she says I should not honour, defend, and listen to her... it is the only time she has ever been wrong.
Ninefingers_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_44.context: NodeContext: 'Heh' is not a laugh so much as a quiet grunt of acknowledgement. He's coming around, and knows he has to listen

Ninefingers_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_81.speaker: Minsc
Ninefingers_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_81.text: If she trusts in Nine-Fingers - if you do - then so will Minsc. But that means, the things Minsc has done...

Ninefingers_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_31.speaker: Player
Ninefingers_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_31.text: If you can't tell ally from enemy, Minsc, maybe you're no hero at all.

Ninefingers_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_37.speaker: Player
Ninefingers_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_37.text: She's right. The Guild will fight for the city - we just have to let them.

Ninefingers_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_82.speaker: Minsc
Ninefingers_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_82.text: ...I am shamed. Nydeshka, unworthy to fight alongside my friends! Boo - what am I to do?
Ninefingers_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_82.context:
NodeContext: Quietly devastated (or quietly for Minsc)
He's seeing how much damage he did as the Stone Lord, and declaring himself ny-DESH-kah - 'Blunt Blade' in Rashemi custom, a berserker who cannot be trusted to fight alongside his friends, and so is given a blunt blade in order to do no harm.

Ninefingers_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_57.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
Ninefingers_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_57.text: I can't speak for your rodent, but I know something of debts. If you reckon you've got one to repay... well, we could always work together.
Ninefingers_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_57.context: NodeContext: Broaching the topic - attempting an olive branch

Ninefingers_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_28.speaker: Minsc
Ninefingers_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_28.text: With you? Minsc has no lust for gold, that he would shake grandmothers by their ankles, or set Boo nibbling at their purse-strings!
Ninefingers_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_28.context: NodeContext: Indignant at the idea of joining the Guild

Ninefingers_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_72.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
Ninefingers_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_72.text: I'm not talking about that. We've both got bigger enemies than one another - the city's enemies.

Ninefingers_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_32.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
Ninefingers_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_32.text: And, Tyr's honest truth... you gave my Guild the wake-up call it needed. We've grown complacent, lazy. Too sure of our standing.

Ninefingers_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_56.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
Ninefingers_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_56.text: We never would've needed the Zhent if we'd had a fighting force of our own. Swords for the city, when the watch and Fist fail us.
Ninefingers_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_56.context: NodeContext: Convincing Minsc he could be a force for good - it should be an open question whether she's sincere or not, not obviously cunning or overly earnest. 'Sure, why not?'

Ninefingers_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_7.speaker: Minsc
Ninefingers_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_7.text: Like a berserker lodge of my homeland. No army or militia, serving the local lords - but heroes, working for the common good!
Ninefingers_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_7.context: NodeContext: Dawning, gaining enthusiasm at the idea

Ninefingers_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_75.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
Ninefingers_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_75.context: NodeContext: Not quite how she'd have phrased it

Ninefingers_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_43.speaker: Minsc
Ninefingers_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_43.text: Very well - Minsc and Boo accept!

Ninefingers_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_92.speaker: Minsc
Ninefingers_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_92.text: Boo and I will be your berserker lodge, taking the ugly ways of your Guild and beating them into a more virtuous shape!

Ninefingers_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_78.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
Ninefingers_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_78.text: That's... not even slightly what I was saying. I wasn't asking -

Ninefingers_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_8.speaker: Minsc
Ninefingers_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_8.text: You are right - I have proven myself unworthy. I cannot serve the city if I was so easily turned against it. If I do not know my own mind... perhaps I no longer know what is good.
Ninefingers_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_8.context: NodeContext: Enthusiasm dissipating to dejection again. Genuine, quiet doubt - not melodramatic

Ninefingers_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_58.speaker: Player
Ninefingers_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_58.text: Simple, then. Trust that Boo will guide you both.

Ninefingers_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_93.speaker: Minsc
Ninefingers_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_93.text: Boo. Kingpin Boo! My friend - your wisdom is vast and unknowable as the Rashemi High Country!

Ninefingers_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_34.speaker: Minsc
Ninefingers_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_34.text: What say you, Boo? When the Absolute is slain, shall we join Nine-Fingers Keene and show her the ways of goodness?

Ninefingers_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_63.speaker: Jaheira
Ninefingers_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_63.text: You did say he was your hero, Astele. Maybe you'll learn something.
Ninefingers_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_63.context: NodeContext: Amused, enjoying how even Nine-Fingers can't rein Minsc in when he gets going

Ninefingers_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_24.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
Ninefingers_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_24.text: Can't we just go back to killing one another instead?

Ninefingers_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_49.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
Ninefingers_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_49.text: ...All right. Fine. Let's leave this particular fight for when the actual war is won, shall we?

Ninefingers_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_42.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
Ninefingers_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_42.text: With the Stone Lord off my back, I'll be able bring my people out of hiding. Cobble together a force so we're ready when you call on us.

Ninefingers_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_61.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
Ninefingers_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_61.text: You have my thanks. Though I'm still not actually sure you haven't made my life that little bit harder.

Ninefingers_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_90.speaker: Player
Ninefingers_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_90.text: Minsc, I'm fairly certain that 'good' is literally the only thing you do know.

Ninefingers_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_79.speaker: Minsc
Ninefingers_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_79.text: My friend, I am touched by your kind words. And now I must be equal to them!
Ninefingers_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_79.context: NodeContext: Not getting that we may have just insulted him

Ninefingers_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_15.speaker: Player
Ninefingers_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_15.text: You have nothing to prove to her. You don't belong in the Guild.

Ninefingers_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_38.speaker: Minsc
Ninefingers_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_38.text: You have planted a burr in my brain, guildmaster. Once I have dislodged the worm and redeemed myself in my hamster's eyes... we will return to this matter.
Ninefingers_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_38.context: NodeContext: Nodding, assuming a more grave tone - the matter is shelved for now, and he and 9F might well go back to fighting when all of this is done.

Ninefingers_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_4.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
Ninefingers_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_4.text: My door is always open. Stone Lord.
Ninefingers_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_4.context: NodeContext: Agreeing to the truce for now, but should contain a hint of threat. Calling him Stone Lord is a reminder that they're not friends.

Ninefingers_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_47.speaker: Player
Ninefingers_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_47.text: We need to focus on the Absolute. You can negotiate your alliance afterwards.

Ninefingers_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_30.speaker: Minsc
Ninefingers_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_30.text: No. Minsc has not always done what is right - but evil is evil. It is a choice - and Nine-Fingers made hers a long time ago.

Ninefingers_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_36.speaker: Minsc
Ninefingers_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_36.text: That story you told... if it be true, then... I am sorry I could not save you then.

Ninefingers_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_71.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
Ninefingers_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_71.text: Oh, you fool. I didn't need saving - from you, or anyone else. But - I suppose I'm sorry, too.

Ninefingers_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_25.speaker: Jaheira
Ninefingers_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_25.context: NodeContext: At a loss - wanting to keep the peace between them but knowing it's going to come to blows.

Ninefingers_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_11.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
Ninefingers_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_11.text: You tried, Harper. Don't worry - I never expected you'd let your friend die without a fight. That's one of the reasons I liked you.
Ninefingers_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_11.context: NodeContext: Shrugging, pragmatic - she genuinely likes and respects Jaheira, but knows that if Minsc dies, so must she. Won't hold it against Jaheira for trying to kill her in return, it's inevitable.

Ninefingers_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_76.speaker: Player
Ninefingers_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_76.text: History will remember the Stone Lord as far worse a villain than Nine-Fingers. Don't make it worse.

Ninefingers_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_87.speaker: Player
Ninefingers_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_87.text: Enough, Nine-Fingers. Minsc has been manipulated enough.

Ninefingers_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_74.speaker: Minsc
Ninefingers_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_74.text: Yes. I may not be able to trust my mind, but I trust my friend. Evil is evil - it is a choice and you made yours a long time ago.

Ninefingers_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_91.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
Ninefingers_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_91.text: I'm confused, if that counts. But if he no longer answers to Stone Lord...

Ninefingers_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_64.speaker: Player
Ninefingers_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_64.text: Explain it all - the tadpole, the Absolute, his time as the Stone Lord.

Ninefingers_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_54.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
Ninefingers_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_54.text: The some sorry tale as yours, then? Bizarre as it is - it explains how this idiot wound up serving the Dead Three.
Ninefingers_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_54.context: NodeContext: Knows she should doubt our story, but doesn't

Ninefingers_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_94.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
Ninefingers_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_94.text: A bizarre tale - but it fits this idiot, somehow. But if he's back to himself...

Ninefingers_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_66.speaker: Nine-Fingers Keene
Ninefingers_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_66.text: The Zhent are down - just you and me now, Stone Lord. So if you mean to take my chair, you'll get no better chance than this.
Ninefingers_OM_Minsc_COM_OOM_66.context: NodeContext: Just after one battle but her blood is up now and she's ready for us to attack - urging us to do it
